abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Avian Influenza Control
            Project for Nepal were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory and borrower
            performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: Despite Government of Nepal (GON) having a
            high interest in constructing two Bio-safety Level 3
            Laboratory (BSL3) laboratories, their sustainability,
            including cost benefit, should have been more carefully
            analyzed at appraisal. The project also managed media
            through local and national daily briefings during
            containment. This was also supported by training for media
            spokespersons. The three agencies set up a communication
            task force soon after the project became effective and
            worked closely in developing common prevention messages and
            focusing their delivery in 26 high-risk districts.
